meanings.definition: Having more wind or air moving
meanings.sent2: The top of the mountain is always windier.
meanings.sent3: The windier it gets, the more my hair flies around!
meanings.sent4: The kite flew higher in the windier sky.
meanings.sent5: The windier it became, the harder it was to walk forward.

meanings.definition: Moving in a twisting or turning way
meanings.sent1: The snake slithered in a windier path.
meanings.sent2: The river took a windier route through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The windier road led us to a hidden waterfall.
meanings.sent4: The dancer moved in a windier motion across the stage.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches swayed in a windier dance.

meanings.definition: Talking a lot without saying much
meanings.sent1: She always becomes windier when she's nervous.
meanings.sent2: His windier speeches never seem to end.
meanings.sent3: The windier he talks, the less I understand.
meanings.sent4: Her windier explanations confused everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The windier he got, the more people started to yawn.
